Cows are milked by attaching a cluster of tubes to their teats. The tubes are connected to a vacuum pump. The vacuum pump creates a vacuum to pull the milk from the cow's teats into a storage tank.
Milk is a white liquid produced by the mammary glands of mammals. It is the primary source of nutrition for young mammals before they are able to digest other types of food.
